TITLE: Sunday was the hottest day ever recorded on Earth
SUMMARY: The average global temperature reached 17.09 degrees Celsius, or about 62.76 Fahrenheit, which is just above the record set last July

TITLE: Hydrothermal explosion at Yellowstone sends up geyser of rock and steam
SUMMARY: There were no injuries in the eruption near Old Faithful, but parts of Biscuit Basin are closed and damage assessments are underway

TITLE: Monday was the world's hottest day ever recorded — breaking Sunday's short-lived record
SUMMARY: Global temperature records have been broken twice in a row this week

TITLE: Smoke from wildfires in Canada and the West Coast spreads across North America
SUMMARY: An animation from NASA shows the smoke blanketing many parts of Canada and at least a handful of U.S. states

TITLE: Scientists have confirmed a cave on the moon that could be used to shelter future explorers
SUMMARY: The cave isn't far from where Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed 55 years ago. The moon may have hundreds more like it

TITLE: Melting ice is slowing Earth's rotation, shifting its axis and even influencing its core, study shows
SUMMARY: Two new studies suggest human behavior has changed foundational elements of the planet’s physical properties

TITLE: Near-complete Stegosaurus fossil sells for record $44 million at auction
SUMMARY: The skeleton, touted as one of the best-preserved of its kind ever found, was discovered on private land in Colorado in 2022

TITLE: What the 9 human cases of bird flu in the U.S. so far tell us about the disease
SUMMARY: The illnesses, all in farm workers, have been relatively mild — a contrast to the flu’s deadly effect on many birds and some mammals

TITLE: Four dead in a week: Heat leads to tragedies in state and national parks
SUMMARY: The parents of a 30-year-old woman found dead in a Utah state park are in critical condition from heat exhaustion. "They don’t know yet their daughter passed away," a friend said

TITLE: California fire outlook grows more worrisome after heat dries out tall grass fed by winter rain
SUMMARY: More than twice the usual acreage has burned in California for this time in the fire season
